website_summaries.verdict: A pocket-size peak flow device that uses Bluetooth technology to connect to your smart phone.
pros: The Smart ONE Personal Pocket Spirometer is a small, convenient device that can measure peak flow (PEF) and FEV1 values
It requires two AAA alkaline batteries (included) and comes with MIR's SMART ONE app so you can track your numbers over time
cons: Compared to other models on the market, which do not have Bluetooth connectivity, this one is a little pricey

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: I have ILD and am currently on the UW Transplant list for double lungs. I've had lung problems for about 13 years. We have actually (the UW Transplant group) have made the decision to change from our screen spirometers to this hand held and app product because it is so user friendly and it tracks more accurately with out having you as the patient blow too many times, because lets face it, when you have bad lungs- reblowing to get the machine to register actually makes things worse! Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: Does not have most spirometry readings.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive spirometer. Easy to use. App needs to include FCV, FEF25/75, FEV1/FVC to be useful. 3rd party uses same spirometer with APP that provides most useful reading.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G. Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. I tested it against 2 mechanical peak flow meters. Connects easily with your iphone and gives you a lot of data and metrics that you can save and email. This is professional medical equipment that works well. When you blow into the tube your breath spins a propeller. Optical sensors in the unit measure the rpm and duration to determine you measurements. Very ingenious!
customer_reviews.author: Bazaar

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Small! Freeing!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Peak Flow meter. First one was from another manufacturer. I always had to connect it to my PC to see results over time. The Smart One connects to my iPhone seamlessly and allows for emailing to doctor or just for my review. It is quite small, about half the size of my previous one. I highly recommend it. Extremely portable.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Syncs well with iphone
customer_reviews.text: This spirometer works great. Things I'd change: #1. It only keeps the best reading of the three when you do a test. I'd like to have all three to be able to say confidently it wasn't an aberrant reading. If it reads 720, 610 and 605 it will just keep the 720 when the low 600s is more likely the correct reading. #2. I can't find replacement spacers. I know it's supposed to be a personal spirometer, but who isn't going to let others try it when it is so cool and who wants to share a spacer!?
customer_reviews.author: Allen George

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Made keeping track of my FEV1 much easier and more convenient. The app works flawlessly, I can export trends to my doc and this thing is slim and portable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: angelicrescue45

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use App and very clear instructions make this device wonderful to use
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised as the easy download and setup of this device through the App on my IPhone. The app was easy to use and intuitive. The results from the testing easy to understand and track over time. It even interacts with my apple health app just like my fit bit. Would highly recommend for any one who wants to check their pulmonary function on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: thomas moran

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but accurate
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to connect to my phone and use. It only took a few minutes to set it up. The numbers seem to be accurate, as they match my previous results from my doctor. The product is cheaply made though. The plastic is really thin and feels like it would break if you dropped it. I expected it to be better quality for the price. I would have been better off buying a cheap one and using a separate app to enter my data into.
customer_reviews.author: Cjc

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Double lung transplant patient here. Needed something to check my fev1 at home. Had it for a month now and it’s been great. Gives a really good indication of where I am. Easy to set up on phone. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool
customer_reviews.text: Very cool tool. I'm a lifelong asthma sufferer. If you understand Pulmonary Function Tests, you will enjoy this tool. Easy use and plot my data. I compared with my previous reports at the doctor office and so far it seems it is decently accurate. It's nice to plot and see my lung capacity on a more usual basis.
customer_reviews.author: bh

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have cystic fibrosis and is a great tool to track daily functions. Accurate for the use of seeing if going down. I like takes the best of 3 attempts like at clinic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a sealed box. But redy to go. Was in an amazon package envelope.
customer_reviews.text: I like that is one day shipped. I do not like it was not sealed. No plastic just a easy to open box and it was sitting inside redy to go. I wonder if its used. Because there was no safety strip or tape. Im hoping its new and un used. Unsure about accuracy because i have nothing to compare it to.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: I want to return it
customer_reviews.text: I wish to return this item. It was not in a sealed box and in this pandemic environment, I want nothing to do with this product. It has no wrapping insode the box either and therefore I have no idea that it has not been used !
customer_reviews.author: EDNA CAHILL

customer_reviews.title: product not sealed
customer_reviews.text: Not protected, no seal, not even a simple plastic cover, dont bother to buy, could be that someone sued it and put it back
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for all asthmatics
customer_reviews.text: Much needed for all asthmatics. I am keeping track of the trend and went to ER when it dropped to my yellow zone. Not sure of accuracy but like the trend you can see.
customer_reviews.author: Vonda Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Well spent money fantastic help
customer_reviews.text: It is very quick there may be some discrepancies between this and a manual one but overall the app and functions is fantastic. Being able to sync with my phone is wonderful. It allows me the chance to monitor my status and keep track of how I am doing very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: A Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Compact Peak Flow Spirometer
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use Spirometer that can be integrated into your phone. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: balldt

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Spirometer
customer_reviews.text: Works easily does just what I need, but it does need regular cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Mag

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions aren't that great. Just download the app first and then search for Bluetooth connection. Can't believe how expensive this was for a very simple device but it records and tracks measurements so you don't have to. Worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Aprilleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good for gathering data on FEV
customer_reviews.text: Only issueis hooking up to bluetooth consistently. Once it hooks up, it works great. FEV1 Numbers compare well with lung function testing at doctor's office.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Czysz

customer_reviews.title: Every asthmatic needs to have this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Works great. Helps keep track of my scores & also interfaces with my iPhone Health App. Able to share results with my doctor. Small & light makes it easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal NY Mets Fan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and was excited to use it and once I opened it and tried it out it pairs to my phone and it looks like it is all set up but once I blow nothing happens. So disappointing ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I have a very serious lung disease and I need to know how well or bad my lungs are with regards to receiving and expelling oygen!
customer_reviews.author: Poppa Tom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for asthmatics
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, when I received this item, it felt like a cheap piece of plastic. Once I started using it - WOW! The product is super easy to use, the app is extremely user friendly, and being able to show my doctor my peak flow history with just a press of a button was SO helpful. I love the notes section and being able to add the ratings of sputum, cough, etc. as well as write in circumstances such as “on antibiotics” or “after a 30 minute walk.” For a person with asthma over 60 years, this truly helps me self monitor better than anything I have ever tried before. It was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ysabeau

customer_reviews.title: A handy device for managing asthma.
customer_reviews.text: This device, along with the app, Maske tracking peak flow measurements very easy. But using it with MedM Health provides even more detail, showing pretty much the same spirometry graph you would see with a lung function test. The service is easy to use; start the app and follow the instructions. It's easy to clean as well. The only thing I wish it had was a display so that it could be used stand-alone; it will not work without the app.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre A. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Product!
customer_reviews.text: In this time of sheltering at home due to covid, we were able to send this objective information to my husband’s doctor and show the need for intervention that enabled him to obtain the necessary inhaler that relieved his shortness of breath. THIS ITEM HAS CHANGED HIS LIFE.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Good value for the money. Would like more options for output.
customer_reviews.text: It is very simple to use. The phone app is very clear and intuitive. I dislike that the only output format for the data is a PDF file. I would rather some text option or comma delimited to enable easier offline analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Beach Flanagans

customer_reviews.title: Easily monitor your lung function
customer_reviews.text: Gives the same readings at my doctors on monthly trip Its the simplest of test and yes it can with the right software do more but that's only accessible if you know who paid the manufacturer to allow them to customize (at any rate I couldn't easily find a way to do it online)
customer_reviews.author: SaRAoRAH

customer_reviews.title: frustrating  product
customer_reviews.text: This MIR spirometer is bulky 3 piece of plastic that is not practical for travel. It is not accurate and in order to use it one must provide abundance of private information in the app .
customer_reviews.author: Ms. 66666

customer_reviews.title: HealthKit compatible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on sale ($79) to test Apple HomeKit compatibility. Confirmed it syncs data via bluetooth to HealthKit on iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN

customer_reviews.title: About MIR SmartOne
customer_reviews.text: There is some problem with the turbine based spirometer, and this device is just a peak flow meter. The device is easy to use, however, the accuracy is my concern. When I removed the turbine, I confirm the inertia issues will affect the FEV1, and FVC. It should be the reason why Smartphone only gets PEF approval. The advance version Spirobank is expensive but uses the same turbine mouthpiece. You also can try the CES innovation awards "ezOxygen", but it is not medical device grade now.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

product_meta.title: MIR Smart ONE | Personal Pocket Spirometer | Peak Flow (PEF) and FEV1
feature_bullets: All it takes is a one second blow to check your lung function when and where you want.
Measures two parameters, Peak Flow and FEV1, directly on your smartphone via Bluetooth.
Ready-to-use out of the box, easy to use.
Suitable for all ages from 5 to 93. Ideal for family use.
Free MIR Smart One APP (iOS & Android), for the real-time display of results on your smartphone.
